BatchCreateAttendee.name: BatchCreateAttendee
BatchCreateAttendee.documentation: Creates up to 100 attendees for an active Amazon Chime SDK meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

BatchUpdateAttendeeCapabilitiesExcept.name: BatchUpdateAttendeeCapabilitiesExcept
BatchUpdateAttendeeCapabilitiesExcept.documentation: Updates AttendeeCapabilities except the capabilities listed in an ExcludedAttendeeIds table.

CreateAttendee.name: CreateAttendee
CreateAttendee.documentation: Creates a new attendee for an active Amazon Chime SDK meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

CreateMeeting.name: CreateMeeting
CreateMeeting.documentation: Creates a new Amazon Chime SDK meeting in the specified media Region with no initial attendees. For more information about specifying media Regions, see Amazon Chime SDK Media Regions in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

CreateMeetingWithAttendees.name: CreateMeetingWithAttendees
CreateMeetingWithAttendees.documentation: Creates a new Amazon Chime SDK meeting in the specified media Region, with attendees. For more information about specifying media Regions, see Amazon Chime SDK Media Regions in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

DeleteAttendee.name: DeleteAttendee
DeleteAttendee.documentation: Deletes an attendee from the specified Amazon Chime SDK meeting and deletes their JoinToken. Attendees are automatically deleted when a Amazon Chime SDK meeting is deleted. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

DeleteMeeting.name: DeleteMeeting
DeleteMeeting.documentation: Deletes the specified Amazon Chime SDK meeting. The operation deletes all attendees, disconnects all clients, and prevents new clients from joining the meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

GetAttendee.name: GetAttendee
GetAttendee.documentation: Gets the Amazon Chime SDK attendee details for a specified meeting ID and attendee ID. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

GetMeeting.name: GetMeeting
GetMeeting.documentation: Gets the Amazon Chime SDK meeting details for the specified meeting ID. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

ListAttendees.name: ListAttendees
ListAttendees.documentation: Lists the attendees for the specified Amazon Chime SDK meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

UpdateAttendeeCapabilities.name: UpdateAttendeeCapabilities
UpdateAttendeeCapabilities.documentation: The capabilties that you want to update.

ExternalUserId.documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.

JoinToken.documentation: The join token used by the Amazon Chime SDK attendee.

Capabilities.documentation: The capabilities (audio, video, or content) assigned to an attendee.

Attendee.documentation:
An Amazon Chime SDK meeting attendee. Includes a unique AttendeeId and JoinToken. The JoinToken allows a client to authenticate and join as the specified attendee. The JoinToken expires when the meeting ends, or when DeleteAttendee is called. After that, the attendee is unable to join the meeting.

We recommend securely transferring each JoinToken from your server application to the client so that no other client has access to the token except for the one authorized to represent the attendee.

Audio.documentation: The audio capability assigned to an attendee.

Video.documentation: The video capability assigned to an attendee.

Content.documentation: The content capability assigned to an attendee.

AttendeeCapabilities.documentation: The media capabilities of an attendee, including audio, video and content.

AttendeeId.documentation: A list of one or more attendee IDs.

AttendeeIdItem.documentation: A structure that contains one or more attendee IDs.

EchoReduction.documentation: Makes echo reduction available to clients who connect to the meeting.

AudioFeatures.documentation: An optional category of meeting features that contains audio-specific configurations, such as operating parameters for Amazon Voice Focus.

RequestId.documentation: The request id associated with the call responsible for the exception.

BadRequestException.documentation: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

MeetingId.documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK ID of the meeting to which you're adding attendees.

Attendees.documentation: The attendee information, including attendees' IDs and join tokens.
The attendee information, including attendees' IDs and join tokens.

Errors.documentation: If the action fails for one or more of the attendees in the request, a list of the attendees is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

MeetingId.documentation: The ID of the meeting associated with the update request.

ExcludedAttendeeIds.documentation: The AttendeeIDs that you want to exclude from one or more capabilities.

Capabilities.documentation: The capabilities (audio, video, or content) that you want to update.

ConflictException.documentation: Multiple instances of the same request have been made simultaneously.

ExternalUserId.documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.

CreateAttendeeError.documentation: The list of errors returned when errors are encountered during the BatchCreateAttendee and CreateAttendee actions. This includes external user IDs, error codes, and error messages.

ExternalUserId.documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.

Capabilities.documentation: The capabilities (audio, video, or content) that you want to grant an attendee. If you don't specify capabilities, all users have send and receive capabilities on all media channels by default.

ExternalUserId.documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. An idempotency token. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.

Capabilities.documentation: A list of one or more capabilities.

CreateAttendeeRequestItem.documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK attendee fields to create, used with the BatchCreateAttendee action.

Attendee.documentation: The attendee information, including attendee ID and join token.

ClientRequestToken.documentation: The unique identifier for the client request. Use a different token for different meetings.

MediaRegion.documentation:
The Region in which to create the meeting.

Available values: af-south-1, ap-northeast-1, ap-northeast-2, ap-south-1, ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, ca-central-1, eu-central-1, eu-north-1, eu-south-1, eu-west-1, eu-west-2, eu-west-3, sa-east-1, us-east-1, us-east-2, us-west-1, us-west-2.

Available values in AWS GovCloud (US) Regions: us-gov-east-1, us-gov-west-1.

NotificationsConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for resource targets to receive notifications when meeting and attendee events occur.

MeetingFeatures.documentation: Lists the audio and video features enabled for a meeting, such as echo reduction.

PrimaryMeetingId.documentation: When specified, replicates the media from the primary meeting to the new meeting.

Meeting.documentation: The meeting information, including the meeting ID and MediaPlacement.

ClientRequestToken.documentation: The unique identifier for the client request. Use a different token for different meetings.

MediaRegion.documentation:
The Region in which to create the meeting.

Available values: af-south-1, ap-northeast-1, ap-northeast-2, ap-south-1, ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, ca-central-1, eu-central-1, eu-north-1, eu-south-1, eu-west-1, eu-west-2, eu-west-3, sa-east-1, us-east-1, us-east-2, us-west-1, us-west-2.

Available values in AWS GovCloud (US) Regions: us-gov-east-1, us-gov-west-1.

MeetingFeatures.documentation: Lists the audio and video features enabled for a meeting, such as echo reduction.

NotificationsConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for resource targets to receive notifications when meeting and attendee events occur.

Attendees.documentation: The attendee information, including attendees' IDs and join tokens.

PrimaryMeetingId.documentation: When specified, replicates the media from the primary meeting to the new meeting.

Meeting.documentation: The meeting information, including the meeting ID and MediaPlacement.

Attendees.documentation: The attendee information, including attendees' IDs and join tokens.

Errors.documentation: If the action fails for one or more of the attendees in the request, a list of the attendees is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

LanguageCode.documentation: The language code specified for the Amazon Transcribe Medical engine.

Specialty.documentation: The specialty specified for the Amazon Transcribe Medical engine.

VocabularyName.documentation: The name of the vocabulary passed to Amazon Transcribe Medical.

Region.documentation: The AWS Region passed to Amazon Transcribe Medical. If you don't specify a Region, Amazon Chime uses the meeting's Region.

ContentIdentificationType.documentation: Set this field to PHI to identify personal health information in the transcription output.

EngineTranscribeMedicalSettings.documentation: Settings specific to the Amazon Transcribe Medical engine.

LanguageCode.documentation: The language code specified for the Amazon Transcribe engine.

VocabularyFilterMethod.documentation: The filtering method passed to Amazon Transcribe.

VocabularyFilterName.documentation: The name of the vocabulary filter passed to Amazon Transcribe.

VocabularyName.documentation: The name of the vocabulary passed to Amazon Transcribe.

Region.documentation: The AWS Region passed to Amazon Transcribe. If you don't specify a Region, Amazon Chime uses the meeting's Region.

EnablePartialResultsStabilization.documentation: Generates partial transcription results that are less likely to change as meeting attendees speak. It does so by only allowing the last few words from the partial results to change.

PartialResultsStability.documentation: The stabity level of a partial results transcription. Determines how stable you want the transcription results to be. A higher level means the transcription results are less likely to change.

ContentIdentificationType.documentation: Set this field to PII to identify personally identifiable information in the transcription output.

ContentRedactionType.documentation:
Set this field to PII to redact personally identifiable information in the transcription output. Content redaction is performed only upon complete transcription of the audio segments.

You can’t set ContentRedactionType and ContentIdentificationType in the same request. If you set both, your request returns a BadRequestException.

PiiEntityTypes.documentation:
Lists the PII entity types you want to identify or redact. To specify entity types, you must enable ContentIdentificationType or ContentRedactionType.

PIIEntityTypes must be comma-separated. The available values are: BANK_ACCOUNT_NUMBER, BANK_ROUTING, CREDIT_DEBIT_NUMBER, CREDIT_DEBIT_CVV, CREDIT_DEBIT_EXPIRY, PIN, EMAIL, ADDRESS, NAME, PHONE, SSN, and ALL.

PiiEntityTypes is an optional parameter with a default value of ALL.

LanguageModelName.documentation: The name of the language model used during transcription.

IdentifyLanguage.documentation: Automatically identifies the language spoken in media files.

LanguageOptions.documentation: Language codes for the languages that you want to identify. You must provide at least 2 codes.

EngineTranscribeSettings.documentation: Settings specific to the Amazon Transcribe engine.

RequestId.documentation: The request id associated with the call responsible for the exception.

ForbiddenException.documentation: The client is permanently forbidden from making the request.

RequestId.documentation: The request id associated with the call responsible for the exception.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in a single call.

NextToken.documentation: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results.

MediaPlacement.documentation: A set of endpoints used by clients to connect to the media service group for an Amazon Chime SDK meeting.

MediaRegion.documentation:
The Region in which you create the meeting. Available values: af-south-1, ap-northeast-1, ap-northeast-2, ap-south-1, ap-southeast-1, ap-southeast-2, ca-central-1, eu-central-1, eu-north-1, eu-south-1, eu-west-1, eu-west-2, eu-west-3, sa-east-1, us-east-1, us-east-2, us-west-1, us-west-2.

Available values in AWS GovCloud (US) Regions: us-gov-east-1, us-gov-west-1.

MeetingFeatures.documentation: The features available to a meeting, such as Amazon Voice Focus.

PrimaryMeetingId.documentation: When specified, replicates the media from the primary meeting to this meeting.

Meeting.documentation: A meeting created using the Amazon Chime SDK.

Audio.documentation: The configuration settings for the audio features available to a meeting.

MeetingFeaturesConfiguration.documentation: The configuration settings of the features available to a meeting.>

RequestId.documentation: The request ID associated with the call responsible for the exception.

NotFoundException.documentation: One or more of the resources in the request does not exist in the system.

LambdaFunctionArn.documentation: The ARN of the AWS Lambda function in the notifications configuration.

NotificationsConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for resource targets to receive notifications when meeting and attendee events occur.

RequestId.documentation: The request id associated with the call responsible for the exception.

RetryAfterSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds the caller should wait before retrying.

MeetingId.documentation: The unique ID of the meeting being transcribed.

TranscriptionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for the current transcription operation. Must contain EngineTranscribeSettings or EngineTranscribeMedicalSettings.

MeetingId.documentation: The unique ID of the meeting for which you stop transcription.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the limit.

EngineTranscribeSettings.documentation: The transcription configuration settings passed to Amazon Transcribe.

EngineTranscribeMedicalSettings.documentation: The transcription configuration settings passed to Amazon Transcribe Medical.

TranscriptionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for the current transcription operation. Must contain EngineTranscribeSettings or EngineTranscribeMedicalSettings.

RequestId.documentation: The request id associated with the call responsible for the exception.

UnauthorizedException.documentation: The user isn't authorized to request a resource.

RequestId.documentation: The request id associated with the call responsible for the exception.

UnprocessableEntityException.documentation: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

MeetingId.documentation: The ID of the meeting associated with the update request.

AttendeeId.documentation: The ID of the attendee associated with the update request.

Capabilities.documentation: The capabilties that you want to update.

documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK meetings APIs in this section allow software developers to create Amazon Chime SDK meetings, set the AWS Regions for meetings, create and manage users, and send and receive meeting notifications. For more information about the meeting APIs, see Amazon Chime SDK meetings.
